ai.summary: Lawrenny Walk, Stackpole is an easy 5.1 km circuit in the UK suitable for most ages. The route offers gentle countryside paths around Lawrenny and Stackpole with scenic views and a relaxed pace.
ai.terrain_summary: The walk mainly follows flat, well-maintained paths and grassy lanes. Surfaces are a mix of compact dirt, gravel, and short grass sections, with occasional muddy patches after rain. There may be a few short road sections if parts of the trail connect to village streets.
ai.safety_notes: Wear sturdy walking shoes and bring weather-appropriate clothing. Check the forecast for wind and rain, as exposed coastal areas can be breezy. Bring water, a map or charged phone, and a small first aid kit. Be mindful of uneven ground, farm tracks, and seasonal livestock. Let someone know your plans and tide times if the route approaches the coast.
recommended_gear: Sturdy walking shoes or light hiking boots
Weather-appropriate clothing and a waterproof layer
Hat and sunscreen for sun protection
Map, compass, or fully charged phone with offline map
ai.best_seasons: Spring to Autumn; suitable year-round with proper gear

seo.title: Lawrenny Walk, Stackpole – Easy 5.1 km Coastal Walk in the UK
seo.meta_description: Explore Lawrenny Walk, Stackpole: an easy 5.1 km route in the UK with gentle terrain, countryside views, and practical safety and gear tips for a relaxed day outdoors.
